</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March 31, 2007, Big
Sky&#146;s fleet of Metro and Beechcraft aircraft had remaining lease terms of 5 to
44 months and aggregate monthly lease payments of approximately $0.2&nbsp;million.
On March 12, 2007, Big Sky entered into an agreement with CommutAir to purchase
eight Beechcraft 1900D aircraft and related spare parts with delivery scheduled
during the last half of calendar 2007.&#160;
Big Sky is in the process of obtaining financing for these aircraft.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Facilities</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">MAIR</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">MAIR&#146;s executive offices
are located in downtown Minneapolis, Minnesota.&#160;
MAIR leases approximately 3,370 square feet of office space with lease
payments of approximately $6,000 per month.&#160;
The lease expires on September 30, 2010 but contains an early
termination provision allowing the lease to be cancelled on September 30, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Big Sky</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky&#146;s main hangar and
operations offices are located at the Billings Logan International Airport in
Billings, Montana.&#160; The main facility
consists of a 12,000 square foot building that can hold three aircraft for
maintenance, a parts warehouse, back shop area and two floors of offices.&#160; A two-story building adjacent to the
hangar houses Big Sky&#146;s operations center and flight administration
offices.&#160; These buildings are situated on
approximately 83,000 square feet of land owned by the City of Billings and
leased to Big Sky on long-term facility and ground leases.&#160; The facility lease has a 19-year term,
and the ground lease has a 26-year term.&#160;
In April 2007, Big Sky entered into a five year agreement to lease approximately
5,000 square feet of office space in downtown Billings for various
administrative and reservation functions. The combined monthly lease payments
for all of Big Sky&#146;s facilities are approximately $15,000<b>.</b></font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;">Item 3.&#160; LEGAL
PROCEEDINGS</font><a name="Item3_LegalProceedings_111622"></a></font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mesaba Bankruptcy</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On October 13, 2005,
Mesaba filed a voluntary petition for relief under Chapter 11 of the United
States Bankruptcy Code with the Bankruptcy Court.&#160; The Bankruptcy Court is administering Mesaba&#146;s
case under the caption &#147;In re Mesaba Aviation, Inc., dba Mesaba Airlines, Case
No. 05/39258(GFK).&#148;&#160; On April 9, 2007,
the Bankruptcy Court approved Mesaba&#146;s plan of reorganization, under which
Mesaba exited bankruptcy on April 24, 2007 as a wholly-owned operating
subsidiary of Northwest.&#160; The Bankruptcy
Court will continue to administer the estate and supervise the distribution of
funds from the bankruptcy estate&#146;s liquidating trust.&#160; For more information on Mesaba&#146;s plan of
reorganization, see &#147;Item 8. Financial Statements and Supplementary Data &#150; Note
14.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Goldman Sachs Bankruptcy Claim</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Goldman Sachs Credit
Partners, L.P. (&#147;Goldman&#148;) is the largest creditor in Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy
proceedings, and it holds approximately $58&nbsp;million in disputed claims
asserted by itself or purchased from other creditors.&#160; All of Goldman&#146;s disputed claims are for
aircraft and equipment leases that were rejected by Mesaba.&nbsp; Goldman has
asserted that the stipulated loss provisions of the applicable leases, under
which liquidated damages are calculated, should apply to determine the total
claim amount due to Goldman.&nbsp; Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy estate has filed for
summary judgment with the </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">11</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='11',FILE='C:\Fc\1662456477_P66473CHE_2191611\15927-1-bg-03.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Jun 15 02:05 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Bankruptcy Court
asserting that the liquidated damages constitute unenforceable penalties.&nbsp;
Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy trustee instead believes that the claim allowed to Goldman
should reflect actual damages suffered, which is the amount related to Goldman&#146;s
claim that is recorded in Mesaba&#146;s liabilities subject to compromise.&nbsp;
Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy estate will be funding the litigation expenses related to
the Goldman claim and will be responsible for making a distribution to Goldman
following resolution of the claim.&nbsp; Any payments in excess of actual
damages by Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy estate would ultimately reduce the equity
distribution MAIR expects to receive from the estate.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Saab Leasing Litigation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2002, Fairbrook
Leasing, Inc., Lambert Leasing, Inc. and Swedish Aircraft Holdings AB (&#147;Saab
Leasing&#148;) filed a declaratory judgment action against Mesaba relating to 20
Saab 340A (&#147;340A&#148;) aircraft leased by Mesaba.&nbsp; In 2003, the District Court
declared that the term sheet relating to the leases for the 340A aircraft was a
binding preliminary agreement requiring Mesaba to negotiate in good faith
toward the execution of long-term agreements for each of the 340A aircraft.&nbsp;
Mesaba appealed this ruling, and while the appeal was pending, Saab Leasing
(relying on the District Court&#146;s declaratory judgment ruling) filed a separate
action in the District Court alleging approximately $35&nbsp;million in damages
for past due and future aircraft lease obligations.&nbsp; While the damages
action was pending, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit affirmed
the District Court&#146;s declaratory judgment ruling.&#160; Despite the Eighth Circuit&#146;s ruling, Mesaba
believed, based on advice from its legal counsel, that it had defenses in the
damages case that limited Saab Leasing&#146;s ability to recover damages.&nbsp; The
District Court in the damages action agreed, and on July 6, 2006, granted
Mesaba&#146;s motion for partial summary judgment and ruled that Saab Leasing is not
eligible to receive damages for the majority of its claims against Mesaba.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Because the potential
damages for the remaining claim against Mesaba are not significant, Mesaba
never established any accrual with regard to this litigation within its
condensed financial statements. However, Mesaba was unable to reach a
settlement with Saab Leasing within the context of Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy
proceedings; thus, Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy estate consented to lift the automatic
stay and allow Saab Leasing to appeal the District Court&#146;s July 2006 ruling to
the Eighth Circuit Court of Appeals.&#160;
Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy estate will now be required to fund any litigation
expenses and any amounts that may be due to Saab Leasing if the District Court&#146;s
ruling is reversed. &#160;Any such payments by
Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy estate would ultimately reduce the equity distribution MAIR
may receive from the estate.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">ALPA Litigation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January 2004, MAIR
entered into a letter agreement with ALPA, Mesaba&#146;s pilots&#146; union, that placed
certain limits on the types of aircraft Big Sky may fly and placed additional
requirements on other potential MAIR subsidiaries.&#160; In December 2006, MAIR notified ALPA that
MAIR terminated the letter agreement between the parties.&#160; MAIR then initiated a lawsuit in federal
district court in Houston, Texas requesting a declaratory judgment that the
letter agreement contained no termination date and, therefore, was terminable-at-will.&#160; MAIR has filed a motion for summary judgment,
but the court has not yet ruled on this motion.&#160;
This litigation will not subject MAIR to any judgment for monetary
damages, but instead was filed to allow MAIR to pursue expansion opportunities
with Big Sky and with other potential airline subsidiaries.</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;">Item 4.&#160; SUBMISSION OF
MATTERS TO A VOTE OF SECURITY HOLDERS</font><a name="Item4_SubmissionOfMattersToAVoteO_111627"></a></font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">None.</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;">EXECUTIVE OFFICERS OF THE REGISTRANT</font><a name="ExecutiveOfficersOfTheRegistrant_111635"></a></font></b></h2>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Paul F.
Foley</font></b>, age 54, has been the President and Chief Executive
Officer of MAIR since October 1999 and was President and Chief Executive
Officer of Mesaba from October 1999 to September 2002.&#160; He is also a director of MAIR.&#160; He was Vice President at Atlas Air, Inc. from
December 1996 to September 1999.&#160; Mr.
Foley graduated with a bachelor of science degree from Cornell University and a
master of business administration degree from Southern Methodist University in
Dallas, Texas.</p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Robert E.
Weil</font></b>, age 42, has been Vice President, Chief Financial
Officer and Treasurer of MAIR since January 2000 and also served as Vice
President, Chief Financial Officer of Mesaba from January 2000 to September
2002.&nbsp; </p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">12</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='12',FILE='C:\Fc\1662456477_P66473CHE_2191611\15927-1-bg-03.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Jun 15 02:05 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr.
Weil was the Managing Director of Finance - Ground Operation for
Northwest Airlines from December 1997 until joining MAIR.&nbsp; He also held
the position of Controller - Ground Operations and held various other
finance positions at Northwest since 1991.&#160;
Mr. Weil graduated with a bachelor of arts degree in economics from
Northwestern University and a master of management degree from Northwestern&#146;s
Kellogg Graduate School of Management.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Ruth M.
Timm</font></b>, age 37, joined the Company in April 2005 as its Vice President,
General Counsel.&#160; Ms. Timm was General
Counsel at Integris Metals, Inc. from October 2004 until February 2005, when
the company was sold to a competitor.&#160;
Ms. Timm was an associate in the corporate department of Leonard, Street
and Deinard Professional Association from October 2000 until September 2004,
and an associate at Maun &amp; Simon, PLC from September 1999 to October
2000.&#160; Ms. Timm served as a judicial law
clerk for the Honorable Paul A. Magnuson, Chief Judge, U.S. District Court for
the District of Minnesota from 1997 to 1999.&#160;
She received her law degree from Valparaiso University School of Law in
1997.</p>

<h1 align="center" style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PART II<a name="PartIi_111640"></a></font></b></h1>

<h2 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;">Item 5.&#160; MARKET FOR
REGISTRANT&#146;S COMMON EQUITY, RELATED SHAREHOLDER MATTERS AND ISSUER PURCHASES OF
EQUITY SECURITIES</font><a name="Item5_MarketForRegistrantsCommonE_111643"></a></font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s common
stock is traded under the symbol &#147;MAIR&#148; on the Nasdaq National Market.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table sets
forth, for the periods indicated, the high and low price per share for the
Company&#146;s common stock for the two most recent fiscal years.&#160; Quotations for such periods are as reported
by Nasdaq for National Market issues.&#160;
The Company has not issued cash dividends since September 1995.&#160; The Company is currently analyzing various strategic
alternatives in aviation-related industries, and each of these alternatives
will be weighed against the option of issuing dividends to the Company&#146;s
shareholders.</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">

the number of holders of record of common stock was 527.</font></p>

for the Company&#146;s common stock is Wells Fargo Shareowner Services, 161 North Concord
Exchange, South St. Paul, Minnesota, 55075-0738, telephone:&#160; (651) 450-4064.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The equity
compensation plans approved by the Company&#146;s shareholders are the 1994 Stock
Option Plan, the 1996 Director Stock Option Plan and the 2000 Stock Incentive
Plan.&#160; The 2000 Stock Incentive Plan
contains a provision that automatically increases the authorized shares
available for grant on September 1 of each year by the lesser of </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">13</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='13',FILE='C:\Fc\1662456477_P66473CHE_2191611\15927-1-bg-03.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Jun 15 02:05 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">300,000 or 1% of
the then outstanding common shares.&#160; See &#147;Item
8. Financial Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 10 &#150; Shareholders&#146; Equity&#148;
for additional information regarding the Company&#146;s equity compensation plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Company Stock Performance</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following graph
provides a five-year comparison of the total cumulative returns for the
Company&#146;s Common Stock, the CRSP Index for the Nasdaq Stock Market (U.S.
companies), and the CRSP Index for air carriers traded on NYSE, AMEX and
Nasdaq.&#160; The CRSP Indexes are prepared by
the Center for Research in Security Prices of the University of Chicago.&#160; The total cumulative return for each period
is based on the investment of $100 on March&nbsp;31, 2002, assuming compounded
daily returns and the reinvestment of all dividends.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Comparison of Five-Year
Cumulative Total Returns</font></b></p>

Nasdaq Stock Index</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Purchases of Equity Securities</font></b></p>

 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="34%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.52%;">
  <p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Period</font></b></p>

 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">

  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="104" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="7" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="96" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="18" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="104" style="border:none;"></td>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January 2007, MAIR and
Northwest entered into a Stock Purchase Agreement (&#147;SPA&#148;) under which MAIR
repurchased from Northwest all of the common stock of MAIR owned by
Northwest.&#160; Specifically, MAIR purchased
5,657,113 shares of stock from Northwest at a purchase price of $6.25 per
share.&#160; The closing for the stock
purchase occurred on March 12, 2007, at which time MAIR paid Northwest $4.25
per share, or approximately $24&nbsp;million, and Northwest returned all of the
shares to MAIR for cancellation.&#160; MAIR
will be required to pay to Northwest the remaining $2.00 per share, or
approximately $11.3&nbsp;million, the earlier of October 22, 2007 or the date
on which MAIR receives at least $25&nbsp;million in distributions from Mesaba&#146;s
bankruptcy estate on account of MAIR&#146;s equity interest in Mesaba.&#160; The remaining payment is reflected in
accounts payable within the consolidated financial statements.&#160; On March 12, 2007, Northwest also returned to
MAIR for cancellation a warrant it held to purchase an additional 4,112,500
shares of MAIR&#146;s stock.&#160; The warrant was
issued to Northwest in connection with Mesaba&#146;s and Northwest&#146;s&#146; August 29,
2005 Airline Services Agreement (the &#147;ASA&#148;), but had never vested.</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;">Item 6.&#160; SELECTED
FINANCIAL DATA</font><a name="Item6_SelectedFinancialData_111653"></a></font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following tables set
forth selected financial data with respect to the Company as of the dates and
for the periods indicated.&#160; The selected
financial data has been derived from the Company&#146;s audited consolidated
financial statements.&#160; As of the Petition
Date, the accounts of Mesaba were deconsolidated from the Company&#146;s
consolidated financial statements.&#160;
Therefore, the financial data below excludes Mesaba from the Petition
Date forward.&#160; The financial data set
forth below should be read in conjunction with the Company&#146;s Consolidated
Financial Statements and Notes thereto and &#147;Item 7. Management&#146;s Discussion and
Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Balance&nbsp;Sheet&nbsp;Data:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 37.5pt;text-indent:-19.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Big Sky was purchased
by MAIR in December 2002.&#160; Operating data
for fiscal 2003 is from the date of purchase to March 31, 2003.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 37.5pt;text-indent:-19.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>ASM are determined by
multiplying the number of seats available for passengers by the number of miles
flown.&#160; Amounts are in thousands.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 37.5pt;text-indent:-19.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Revenue passenger
miles are determined by multiplying the number of fare-paying passengers
carried by the distance flown.&#160; Amounts
are in thousands.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 37.5pt;text-indent:-19.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Load factor is
determined by dividing revenue passenger miles by available seat miles.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">16</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='16',FILE='C:\Fc\166213728625_P66485_2194091\15927-1-bg-05.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Jun 15 21:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<h2 style="font-weight:normal;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;">Item 7.&#160; MANAGEMENT&#146;S
DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</font><a name="Item7_ManagementsDiscussionAndAna_111746"></a></font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management&#146;s Discussion
and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations should be read in
conjunction with the accompanying consolidated financial statements.&#160; The Company&#146;s operations and financial
results are subject to various risks and uncertainties as discussed in &#147;Item
1A.&#160; Risk Factors.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Year in
Review and Outlook</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Summary</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At the outset of fiscal
year 2007, MAIR was facing a number of significant challenges.&#160; Mesaba had been in bankruptcy for six months,
its labor negotiations were in disarray and Northwest had threatened to not
only take away Mesaba&#146;s Avro and Canadair regional jet operations, but also
send Mesaba&#146;s Saab business out for bid with other regional airlines.&#160; Separately, Mesaba&#146;s creditors&#146; committee had
launched an investigation of the management fees and dividends paid between
Mesaba and MAIR over the previous five years.&#160;
In addition, with fuel prices at $60 per barrel, Big Sky was unable to
find a way to profitably operate its fleet of ten Beechcraft 1900D aircraft.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In this
environment, MAIR set the following goals for fiscal 2007:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Retaining
the cash at MAIR to preserve financial flexibility as Mesaba reorganized in
bankruptcy;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Maintaining
operating and safety performance at both subsidiaries;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Maximizing
MAIR&#146;s equity value in Mesaba by minimizing creditor&#146;s claims and developing a
plan of reorganization;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Stabilizing
Big Sky&#146;s business plan by expanding its 19-seat operation and pursuing
other partnerships; and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Exploring
other growth opportunities to maximize shareholder value.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">By the end of fiscal
2007, MAIR had achieved its goals, positioning the Company to set out in a new
direction in fiscal 2008:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>As
part of the SPRA, the creditors&#146; committee released MAIR from all claims
associated with the committee&#146;s investigation of the dividends and management
fees paid to MAIR.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Both
subsidiaries maintained operating performance excellence throughout the fiscal
year.&#160; Mesaba accomplished it while
downsizing significantly as the Avros were eliminated from service, and Big Sky
maintained its operating performance while expanding outside the Pacific Northwest
to Illinois and Florida and preparing for the new Boston operation in fiscal
2008.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>During
the negotiations with Northwest regarding Mesaba&#146;s plan of reorganization, MAIR
maximized its equity value in Mesaba by gaining an additional $11&nbsp;million
in value from Northwest - first by Northwest assigning its own $7.3&nbsp;million
claim against Mesaba to MAIR and second by Northwest agreeing that up to $4.0&nbsp;million
of Mesaba&#146;s cash could be used to satisfy cure costs related to assumed
contracts, thus relieving the bankruptcy estate of such liability. &#160;Through these negotiations, MAIR also obtained
Northwest&#146;s agreement to terminate its equity position in MAIR, and on March
12, 2007, MAIR repurchased all of the MAIR stock owned by Northwest.&#160; Immediately after the SPRA was effective, on
January 24, 2007, MAIR, with Mesaba&#146;s creditors&#146; committee, took advantage of
the market opportunity to auction Mesaba&#146;s $145&nbsp;million allowed claim in
Northwest&#146;s bankruptcy, which resulted in a commitment from Goldman Sachs to
purchase the claim for approximately $125&nbsp;million when Mesaba&#146;s plan of
reorganization became effective.&#160; These
proceeds were placed in a liquidating trust on April 24, 2007 to pay Mesaba&#146;s
creditors.&#160; Mesaba has estimated that its
creditors&#146; claims total approximately $94&nbsp;million (including MAIR&#146;s $6.2&nbsp;million
settled claim in Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy and Northwest&#146;s $7.3&nbsp;million claim </p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">17</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='17',FILE='C:\Fc\166213728625_P66485_2194091\15927-1-bg-05.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Jun 15 21:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">assigned to MAIR).&#160;
Assuming these projections are correct, MAIR could receive up to $44&nbsp;million
from Mesaba&#146;s plan of reorganization.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>In
addition to expanding in Illinois, Big Sky entered into an agreement with Delta
to operate Beechcraft 1900D aircraft throughout the Northeast with Boston as
its hub.&#160; As part of that expansion plan,
Big Sky was awarded EAS service between Massena, Ogdensburg and Watertown, New
York and Boston, Massachusetts.&#160; The
Boston operation started successfully in April, 2007.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Symbol" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#183;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Throughout
the fiscal year MAIR reviewed a number of potential transactions to diversify
its operations.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Outlook</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For fiscal 2008, MAIR
will continue to play an active role in Mesaba&#146;s plan of reorganization to
maximize the potential value to MAIR as Mesaba&#146;s former equity holder.&#160; A MAIR representative sits on an oversight
committee to the liquidating trust and will monitor all payments from the trust
to Mesaba&#146;s creditors.&#160; MAIR expects that
all distributions from the trust should be made by the end of fiscal 2008.&#160; While Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy estate is being
resolved, MAIR will also continue to explore additional growth opportunities
for Big Sky and will consider acquisitions to diversify within airline-related
industries.&#160; These opportunities will be
evaluated in the context of maximizing shareholder value and weighed against
other tax efficient mechanisms to return capital to shareholders.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Fiscal Year Ended March 31, 2007 Compared
with Fiscal Year Ended March 31, 2006</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Earnings Summary</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company reported a
consolidated net loss of $7.4&nbsp;million, or $0.36 per basic and diluted
share, for fiscal 2007, compared to net loss of $82.8&nbsp;million, or $4.02
per basic and diluted share, in fiscal 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of the Petition Date,
the accounts of Mesaba were deconsolidated from the Company&#146;s consolidated
financial statements.&#160; Therefore, the
financial data below excludes Mesaba from the Petition Date forward.&#160; Mesaba&#146;s condensed financial statements on a
stand-alone basis are presented in &#147;Item 8. Financial Statements and
Supplementary Data, Note 18 &#150; Financial Information of Mesaba.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Big Sky</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky Operating
Revenues</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total operating revenues
increased 17.2% to $23.9&nbsp;million in fiscal 2007 from $20.4&nbsp;million in
fiscal 2006.&#160; Passenger revenues
increased 19.6% as a result of a 20.3% increase in average fare offset by a
0.5% decrease in passengers transported. Other revenue increased 14.0% as a
result of the new Chicago-Midway to Springfield, Illinois and Eau Claire,
Wisconsin air service.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky Operating
Expenses</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total operating expenses
increased 2.2% to $28.8&nbsp;million in fiscal 2007 from $28.2&nbsp;million in
fiscal 2006.&#160; The following table
compares components of operating cost per ASM for the years ended March 31, in
thousands:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.42%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.9%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(202</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28,843</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.42%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28,225</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.42%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.0%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">618</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.42%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.9%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.2</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.9%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">34.4</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:2.42%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 2.25pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.9%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">36.3</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 2.25pt 0pt;width:1.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal 2007, wages
and benefits increased $1.8&nbsp;million or 23.9% as a result of a 4.8%
increase in block hours, contractual rate increases and hiring and training of
the additional staffing requirements in flight, maintenance and stations for
the new Delta Connection service out of Boston.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">18</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='18',FILE='C:\Fc\166213728625_P66485_2194091\15927-1-bg-05.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Jun 15 21:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft fuel expense
increased 12.6% from fiscal 2006 to fiscal 2007 as a result of a 15 cent
increase in the average price of jet fuel, from $1.98 per gallon in fiscal 2006
to $2.13 per gallon in fiscal 2007, and an increase of 4.8% in block hours in
fiscal 2007 from fiscal 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft maintenance
expense increased 14.6% due to increased flying year-over-year.
Scheduled heavy checks and propeller overhaul events totaled $0.4&nbsp;million
in fiscal 2007, primarily due to a November 2006 FAA wing spar airworthiness
directive which mandated more rigorous inspection of the wing spar portion of
the Beechcraft 1900D aircraft.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The elimination of Metro
aircraft resulted in a 10.0% decrease in aircraft rents and a 23.0% decrease in
depreciation and amortization expense during fiscal 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Insurance and taxes
decreased 16.7% as the result of property tax and aircraft hull insurance
liability adjustments in fiscal 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Administrative and other
expenses increased 10.9%, or $0.7&nbsp;million, in fiscal 2007 over fiscal 2006
as a result of a $0.6&nbsp;million bad debt reserve.&#160; Both fiscal 2007 and 2006 had similar
expenses associated with the Metro aircraft return of $0.8&nbsp;million and
$0.7&nbsp;million, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fiscal 2006 contained a
$2.5&nbsp;million goodwill impairment charge.&#160;
The impairment was determined by comparing the fair value of the
intangible asset to the current carrying value.&#160;
For more information on the impairment, see &#147;Item 8. Financial
Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 3 &#150; Intangible Assets.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">MAIR</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">MAIR Operating Expenses</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total operating expenses
in fiscal 2007 decreased $11.2&nbsp;million to $9.9&nbsp;million from $21.1&nbsp;million
in fiscal 2006, primarily due to $13.7&nbsp;million in impairment and other
charges in fiscal 2006, consisting of an $8.9&nbsp;million write-off of
MAIR&#146;s equity investment in its Mesaba subsidiary and a $4.8&nbsp;million
charge associated with MAIR&#146;s guaranty of Mesaba&#146;s facilities and ground lease
for its facility at the Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International
Airport.&#160; These expenses were offset by a
$1.4&nbsp;million increase in legal and other professional services due to the
Mesaba bankruptcy.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated Operating Income</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating losses totaled
$14.6&nbsp;million in fiscal 2007, as compared to $62.7&nbsp;million in fiscal
2006.&#160; Fiscal 2006 included Mesaba&#146;s
operating losses for approximately six months through the Petition Date.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated Nonoperating Income</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nonoperating income (net)
decreased to $5.2&nbsp;million for fiscal 2007 from $6.0&nbsp;million in fiscal
2006.&#160; The decrease was primarily due to
a $1.8&nbsp;million arbitration settlement with an investment advisor in the
first quarter of fiscal 2006, partially offset by additional interest income
generated by higher interest rates in fiscal 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated Provision for Income Taxes</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company recorded a
tax benefit of $2.0&nbsp;million in fiscal 2007 compared to a benefit of $13.8&nbsp;million
in fiscal 2006.&#160; The Company&#146;s blended
effective tax rate was (21.2)% in fiscal 2007, as compared to (24.4)% in fiscal
2006 after the deconsolidation of Mesaba&#146;s financial results from the Company&#146;s
consolidated financial statements as of the Petition Date.&#160; In fiscal 2007, the benefit of $2.0&nbsp;million
was due to the $0.5&nbsp;million federal benefit of an NOL carryback and a $1.5&nbsp;million
benefit due to a January 2007 settlement with the IRS and the deconsolidation
of Mesaba whereby Mesaba recorded the corresponding $1.5&nbsp;million
expense.&#160; Under the settlement agreement
MAIR agreed to pay the IRS on behalf of Mesaba $1.7&nbsp;million in taxes and
interest for adjustments to taxable income for the reclassification of per diem
amounts.&#160; This settlement resulted in an
additional $0.2&nbsp;million of tax expense at Mesaba in the third quarter of
fiscal 2007 as the Company had previously recorded a reserve of $1.5&nbsp;million
in the prior fiscal year.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In fiscal 2007, the
Company recorded a valuation allowance against its net deferred tax assets of
$3.5&nbsp;million, which resulted in a valuation allowance balance of $6.9&nbsp;million
at March 31, 2007.&#160; The effective tax
rate would have been </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">19</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='19',FILE='C:\Fc\166213728625_P66485_2194091\15927-1-bg-05.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Jun 15 21:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(36.7)% based on book
income and permanent differences exclusive of the valuation allowance.&#160; In fiscal 2006, the Company recorded a
valuation allowance against its net deferred tax assets of $3.6&nbsp;million.&#160; The effective tax rate would have been
(30.8)% exclusive of the valuation allowance.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Fiscal Year Ended March 31, 2006
Compared with Fiscal Year Ended March 31, 2005</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Earnings Summary</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company reported a
consolidated net loss of $82.8&nbsp;million, or $4.02 per basic and diluted
share, in fiscal 2006, compared to net income of $7.4&nbsp;million, or $0.35
per diluted share, in fiscal 2005.&#160; To
allow for a more direct and meaningful comparison, Mesaba&#146;s results of
operations have been analyzed for the entire fiscal years ended March 31, 2006
and 2005 notwithstanding the deconsolidation of Mesaba from the Company&#146;s
consolidated financial statements as of October 13, 2005, the date of Mesaba&#146;s
bankruptcy filing.&#160; Mesaba&#146;s condensed
financial statements on a stand-alone basis are presented in &#147;Item 8.
Financial Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 18 &#150; Financial Information of
Mesaba.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Big Sky</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky Operating Revenues</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total operating revenues
increased 35.1% to $20.4&nbsp;million in fiscal 2006 from $15.1&nbsp;million in
fiscal 2005.&#160; New fiscal 2006 service
between Sheridan, Wyoming and Denver, Colorado, Bozeman, Montana, Pocatello,
Idaho, Walla Walla, Washington and Boise, Idaho contributed to the 27.1%
increase in flying.&#160; The system
experienced an increase of 4.9 load factor points and a 17.6% increase in
average fare in fiscal 2006 compared to fiscal 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other revenues increased
14.8% as a result of a new EAS subsidy contract for service between Sheridan,
Wyoming and Denver, Colorado and an improvement in flight completion of 2.5
points.&#160;&#160; Fiscal 2006 includes ground
handling revenue and a short-term wet lease operation provided by Big Sky
generating $0.3&nbsp;million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Big Sky Operating Expenses</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total operating expenses
in fiscal 2006 increased 41.2% to $28.2&nbsp;million from $20.0&nbsp;million in
fiscal 2006.&#160; The following table
compares components of operating cost per ASM for the years ended March 31, in
thousands:</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.42%;">

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28,225</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.42%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19,991</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">41.2</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 1pt 0pt;width:2.42%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">33.7</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 1pt 0pt;width:1.58%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#162;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal 2006, wages
and benefits increased due to changes in the workers&#146; compensation coverage and
the addition of 44 new pilots and customer service agents due to new service
offerings.&#160; In fiscal 2006, Big Sky paid
actual claims compared to having claims covered by insurance in fiscal 2005.&#160; In fiscal 2005, Big Sky recorded a reserve
for remaining open workers&#146; compensation claims from the previous policy
period.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft fuel represented
the largest expense increase, 95.3%, from fiscal 2005 to fiscal 2006.&#160; The number of gallons of fuel burned increased
approximately 70% due to added flight hours and the Beechcraft 1900D aircraft&#146;s
higher consumption per hour.&#160;
Additionally, the average price per gallon of fuel increased 16% to
$1.98 in fiscal 2006 from $1.71 in fiscal 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft maintenance
increased 36.7% due to increased flying year-over-year.&#160; Block hours increased 27.1%, and ASMs
increased 31.2% from fiscal 2005 to fiscal 2006.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">20</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='20',FILE='C:\Fc\166213728625_P66485_2194091\15927-1-bg-05.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Jun 15 21:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aircraft rents increased 1.9% due to six Beechcraft
aircraft brought on line while three Metro aircraft were retired.&#160; During fiscal 2006, a total of ten Beechcraft
aircraft and four Metro aircraft were leased compared to four Beechcraft and 14
Metro aircraft being leased during fiscal 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The decrease in insurance
and taxes was the result of a property tax adjustment in fiscal 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Administrative and other
expenses increased 20.1%, or $1.1&nbsp;million, in fiscal 2006 over fiscal
2005.&#160; Credit card commissions increased
$0.1&nbsp;million and computer reservation system charges increased $0.2&nbsp;million
in fiscal 2006 as a result of a 32.8% increase in passengers.&#160; In addition, Big Sky recorded $0.8&nbsp;million
in expense associated with the return of non-operating Metro aircraft.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fiscal 2006 contained a
$2.5&nbsp;million goodwill impairment charge.&#160;
The impairment was determined by comparing the fair value of the
intangible asset to the current carrying value.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">MAIR</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">MAIR Operating Expenses</font></u></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total operating expenses
in fiscal 2006 increased to $21.1&nbsp;million from $5.7&nbsp;million in fiscal
2005, primarily due to $13.7&nbsp;million in impairment and other charges,
consisting of an $8.9&nbsp;million write-off of MAIR&#146;s equity investment
in its Mesaba subsidiary and a $4.8&nbsp;million charge associated with MAIR&#146;s
guaranty of Mesaba&#146;s facilities and ground lease for its facility at the
Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International Airport.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated Operating Income</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating losses totaled
$62.7&nbsp;million in fiscal 2006, as compared to operating income of $8.6&nbsp;million
in fiscal 2005.&#160; The Company&#146;s operating
margin decreased to (24.5)% in fiscal 2006 from 2.0% in fiscal 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated Nonoperating Income</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nonoperating income (net)
increased to $6.0&nbsp;million for fiscal 2006 from $2.3&nbsp;million in fiscal
2005.&#160; The increase is primarily due to
increased interest income as a result of higher rates earned on cash and investments
and a $1.8&nbsp;million arbitration settlement with an investment advisor in
the first quarter of fiscal 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Consolidated Provision for Income Taxes</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company recorded a
tax benefit of $13.8&nbsp;million in fiscal 2006 compared to a provision for
income taxes of $3.6&nbsp;million in fiscal 2005.&#160; The Company&#146;s blended effective tax rate was
(24.4)% in fiscal 2006, after the deconsolidation of Mesaba&#146;s financial results
from the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements as of October 13, 2005,
the date of Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy filing, as compared to 32.9% in fiscal 2005,
which includes the financial results of Mesaba. In fiscal 2006, the Company
booked a valuation allowance against its net deferred tax assets of $3.6&nbsp;million.&#160; The effective tax rate would have been
(30.8)% exclusive of the valuation allowance.&#160;
During the first quarter of fiscal 2005, the Company received
verification of a final settlement with the IRS concerning its examination of
the Company&#146;s fiscal 1995 and 1996 income tax returns.&#160; As a result of this settlement, the Company
reduced its income tax payable and tax provision by $1.2&nbsp;million.&#160; Without this adjustment, the Company&#146;s
effective tax rate would have been 43.8% in fiscal 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Liquidity and Capital Resources</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Unrestricted cash, cash
equivalents and investments decreased $44.7&nbsp;million, or 40.4%, to $66.0&nbsp;million
at March 31, 2007 from $110.7&nbsp;million at March 31, 2006.&#160; The Company&#146;s working capital decreased to
$39.9&nbsp;million at March 31, 2007 compared to working capital of $85.9&nbsp;million
at March 31, 2006.&#160; These decreases were
primarily due to MAIR&#146;s purchase of all of Northwest&#146;s 5,657,113 shares of
stock at a purchase price of $6.25 per share.&#160;
The closing for the stock purchase occurred on March 12, 2007, at which
time MAIR paid Northwest $4.25 per share, or approximately $24&nbsp;million.
MAIR will be required to pay Northwest the remaining $2.00 per share, or
approximately $11.3&nbsp;million, the earlier of October 22, 2007 or the date
on which MAIR receives at least $25&nbsp;million in distributions from Mesaba&#146;s
bankruptcy estate on account of MAIR&#146;s equity interest in Mesaba.&#160; The decrease was also due to MAIR recording
restricted cash of $13.1&nbsp;million for MAIR&#146;s establishment of a letter of
credit supporting MAIR&#146;s guaranty of Mesaba&#146;s obligations for the hangar at the
Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International Airport.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">21</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='21',FILE='C:\Fc\166213728625_P66485_2194091\15927-1-bg-05.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Jun 15 21:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Operating Activities</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash used in
operating activities in fiscal 2007 was $9.0&nbsp;million, primarily due to the
Company&#146;s net loss of $7.4&nbsp;million, increases of $2.0&nbsp;million in prepaid
expenses and $1.2&nbsp;million in amortization of investment discounts.&#160; The uses of cash were partially offset by
depreciation and amortization of $0.7&nbsp;million and a decrease in income tax
receivable of $0.9&nbsp;million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Investing Activities</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash provided by
investing activities in fiscal 2007 was $13.3&nbsp;million.&#160; The source of cash from investing activities
was the net sales of short- and long-term investments of $27.3&nbsp;million.&#160; The primary uses of cash were for MAIR&#146;s
establishment of a $13.1&nbsp;million letter of credit supporting MAIR&#146;s
guaranty of Mesaba&#146;s obligations for the hangar at the Cincinnati/Northern
Kentucky International Airport, $0.6&nbsp;million of restricted cash recorded
at Big Sky for certificates of deposit supporting letters of credit for workers&#146;
compensation insurance, aircraft fuel and airport lease agreements, and $0.6&nbsp;million
for purchases of property and equipment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Financing Activities</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash used in
financing activities in fiscal 2007 was $22.8&nbsp;million primarily due to
MAIR&#146;s $24.0&nbsp;million purchase of Northwest&#146;s shares of stock, offset by
$0.5&nbsp;million for MAIR&#146;s proceeds from the exercise of stock options and
$0.8&nbsp;million for MAIR&#146;s intercompany payable to Mesaba for tax refunds
received at MAIR.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other Non-Cash Activities</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In fiscal 2007, MAIR
recorded $10.9&nbsp;million in accounts payable, which reflects the present
value of the $11.3&nbsp;million payable to Northwest for the remaining $2.00
per share from the purchase of Northwest&#146;s shares of stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Outlook</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has
historically relied on cash and cash equivalents, investments and internally
generated funds to support its working capital requirements.&#160; Absent adverse factors outside the control of
the Company, management believes current liquidity and funds from MAIR&#146; and Big
Sky&#146;s operations will provide adequate resources for meeting current
obligations through the end of fiscal 2008 and beyond.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Contractual Obligations,
Commitments and Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Big Sky</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March 31, 2007, Big
Sky&#146;s fleet consisted of 11 aircraft (ten active and one inactive) covered
under operating leases with terms of 5 to 44 months and aggregate monthly lease
payments of approximately $0.2&nbsp;million.&#160;
Big Sky leases its Metro aircraft from AirLift Inc. and its Beechcraft
1900D&#146;s from Mesa Air Group (&#147;Mesa&#148;).&#160;
Funding of the monthly minimum lease payments is dependent on continued
passenger boardings, Big Sky&#146;s operations and, potentially, funding from MAIR.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Although Big Sky&#146;s
airline fleet operating leases contain standard return conditions, the operating
leases do not contain any other guaranteed lease residual provisions or
purchase options for which there would be a potential contingency at the
termination of the lease period.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On March 12, 2007, Big
Sky entered into an agreement with CommutAir to purchase eight Beechcraft 1900D
aircraft and related spare parts with delivery scheduled during the last half
of calendar 2007.&#160; Big Sky is in the
process of obtaining financing for these aircraft.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In April 2007, Big Sky
entered into a five year agreement to lease approximately 5,000 square feet of
office space for $0.1&nbsp;million per year in a downtown Billings office
building for various administrative and reservation functions.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">22</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.94%;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Amounts
represent minimum lease payments with initial or remaining terms of more than
one year.&#160; See &#147;Item 8.&#160; Financial Statements and Supplementary Data,
Note 7 &#150; Leases&#148; for additional discussion of operating leases on non-idled&nbsp;aircraft.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Amounts are
based on lease terms, which have early terminations and extensions.&#160; The Beechcraft 1900D leases have initial
terms of up to five years with early terminations.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 54.0pt;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Amounts
represent principal payments only.&#160; See &#147;Item
8. Financial Statements and Supplementary Data, Note 8 &#150; Notes Payable and Long-Term
Debt&#148; for additional discussion of long-term debt and future maturities.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">MAIR</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In connection with MAIR&#146;s
guaranty of Mesaba&#146;s obligations related to its facility at the
Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International Airport, MAIR is obligated under the
facilities and ground leases for such facility.&#160;
The following table summarizes MAIR&#146;s guaranty to make lease payments
for the years ending March 31, in thousands:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="27%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:27.42%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.94%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2008</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.94%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2011</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
