</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Stock
Appreciation Rights</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective April 1, 2006,
Mesaba adopted the fair value recognition provisions of SFAS No. 123R, <i>Share-Based Payment, </i>(&#147;SFAS 123R&#148;),<i>  </i>using the modified prospective transition method.
Under that transition method, compensation expense that Mesaba recognizes
beginning on that date includes expense associated with the fair value of all
awards granted on and after April 1, 2006, and expense for the unvested portion
of previously granted awards outstanding on April 1, 2006. Results for prior
periods have not been restated.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under SFAS 123R,
forfeitures are estimated at the time of valuation and reduce expense ratably
over the vesting period.&#160; This estimate
is adjusted periodically based on the extent to which actual forfeitures
differ, or are expected to differ, from the previous estimate.&#160; Under SFAS No. 123, <i>Accounting for Stock-Based Compensation</i>
and APB 25, <i>Accounting for Stock Issued to Employees, </i>Mesaba
elected to account for forfeitures when awards are actually forfeited, at which
time all previous pro forma expense will be reversed to reduce pro forma
expense for that period.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The fair value of each
SAR grant is estimated quarterly using the Black-Scholes option pricing model
with the following assumptions:&#160; risk-free
interest rate, stock price volatility and expected life.&#160; Mesaba establishes the risk-free interest
rate using the U.S. Treasury yield curve as of the grant date.&#160; The estimated expected term is consistent
with the simplified method identified in SEC Staff Accounting Bulletin (&#147;SAB&#148;)
No. 107<i>, Share-Based Payment</i>, for share-based
awards granted during fiscal 2007.&nbsp; The simplified method calculates the
expected term as the average of the vesting and contractual terms of the
award.&#160; The expected volatility
assumption is set based primarily on historical volatility.&#160; For SARs granted, Mesaba amortizes the fair
value on a straight-line basis over the vesting period of the SARs.&#160; The fair value and recorded liability is
adjusted each quarter to estimate the current market value.&#160; There were no SARs granted in either fiscal
2007 or 2006.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">10</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='10',FILE='C:\JMS\105442\07-15927-1\task2197779\15927-1-mm-05.htm',USER='105442',CD='Jun 19 05:07 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Revenue
Recognition</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba recognizes
passenger revenue as services are provided.&#160;
For flights utilizing the Saabs, Mesaba recognizes revenue for each
completed ASM.&#160; For flights utilizing the
Avros, Mesaba recognized revenue for each block hour flown.&#160; For flights utilizing the CRJ 200, Mesaba
recognizes revenue through monthly expense reimbursement payments for actual
expenses incurred relating to aircraft rent, maintenance, landing fees and fuel
(which is set at a fixed price of $0.70 per gallon for the CRJ200);
semi-monthly payments for each block hour and cycle operated; a monthly fixed
cost payment based on the size of the CRJ 200 fleet (intended to cover Mesaba&#146;s
costs that are not reimbursed through the monthly reimbursement payments, which
consist mainly of labor costs, ground handling costs, overhead and
depreciation) and margin payments based on the revenues described above
calculated to achieve a target operating margin.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, the ASA
includes semi-annual incentive payments based upon achievement of certain
operational targets, such as completion factor and on-time performance.&#160; Such incentives are earned and due based on
performance over a given period (generally six months).&#160; In periods prior to the finalization of such
operational incentives, revenue is recognized when the targets have been
exceeded.&#160; The amount recognized is limited
to a ratable portion of the incentive payment as if the contract period were to
terminate at the end of the interim period.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Income
Taxes</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba accounts for
income taxes under the asset and liability method whereby deferred income tax
assets and liabilities are computed annually for differences between the
financial statement and tax bases of assets and liabilities.&#160; These differences will result in taxable or
deductible amounts in the future based on enacted tax laws and rates applicable
to the periods in which the differences are expected to affect taxable income.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the provisions of
SFAS No. 109, <i>Accounting for Income Taxes</i>, the
realization of the future tax benefits of a deferred tax asset is dependent on
future taxable income against which such tax benefits can be applied. All
available evidence must be considered in the determination of whether
sufficient future taxable income will exist. Such evidence includes, but is not
limited to, Mesaba&#146;s financial performance, the market environment in which
Mesaba operates, the utilization of past tax credits, and the length of relevant
carryback and carryforward periods. Sufficient negative evidence, such as
cumulative net losses during a three-year period that includes the current year
and the prior two years, may require that a valuation allowance be established
with respect to existing and future deferred tax assets.&#160; A valuation allowance is recorded when
deferred tax assets are not considered more likely than not to be realized.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Fair
Value of Financial Instruments</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba&#146;s financial
instruments consist primarily of cash and cash equivalents of which carrying
amounts do not significantly differ from fair value due to their short-term
nature or variable interest rates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">New
Accounting Pronouncements</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In July 2006, the FASB
issued FASB Interpretation No. 48, <i>Accounting for Uncertainty
in Income Taxes,</i> an interpretation of FASB Statement No.&nbsp;109 (&#147;FIN&nbsp;48&#148;),
which clarifies the accounting for uncertainty in tax positions. FIN 48
requires that Mesaba recognize in its financial statements the impact of a tax
position if that position is more likely than not to be sustained on audit,
based on the technical merits of the position. The accounting provisions of FIN
48 will be effective for Mesaba beginning April 1, 2007. Mesaba is in the
process of determining what effect, if any, the adoption of FIN 48 will have on
its financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September 2006, the
FASB issued SFAS No. 157, <i>Fair Value Measurements </i>(&#147;SFAS
No. 157&#148;), to define fair value, establish a framework for measuring fair value
in accordance with GAAP, and expand disclosures about fair value
measurements.&#160; SFAS No. 157 will be
effective for Mesaba beginning April 1, 2008. Mesaba is in the process of
determining what effect, if any, the adoption of SFAS No. 157 will have on its
financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In September 2006, the FASB
issued FASB Staff Position AUG AIR-1, <i>Accounting for Planned
Major Maintenance Activities </i>(the &#147;FSP&#148;), that reduces the number of
acceptable methods of accounting for planned major maintenance activities. The
FSP will be effective for Mesaba beginning April 1, 2007 and requires
retrospective application to all financial statements presented unless doing so
is impractical.&#160; Mesaba is in the process
of determining what effect the adoption of the FSP will have on its financial
statements.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">11</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='11',FILE='C:\JMS\105442\07-15927-1\task2197779\15927-1-mm-05.htm',USER='105442',CD='Jun 19 05:07 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin-left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
February 2007, the FASB issued SFAS No. 159,<i>
The Fair Value Option for Financial Assets and Financial Liabilities</i>
(&#147;SFAS 159&#148;). SFAS 159 permits entities to choose to measure many financial
instruments and certain other items at fair value that are not currently required
to be measured at fair value. SFAS 159 is effective for fiscal years beginning
April 1, 2008. Mesaba is in the process of determining what effect, if any, the
adoption of SFAS 159 will have on its financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 27.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">3.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Impairment and Other
Charges</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Impairment charges of
$31.2 million were recorded in fiscal 2006 as a result of the $29.1 million
charge to establish a reserve on the unsecured prepetition receivables due from
Northwest (net of certain offsetting liabilities), and the $2.1 million write-off
of the warrants related to the prior airline services agreements (see Note
2).&#160; In the fourth quarter of fiscal
2007, Mesaba wrote-off its Northwest receivables and reduced its reserve by
$29.1 million.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 27.0pt;text-indent:-27.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">4.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Investments</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Investments consist
principally of government, agency, corporate and municipal securities and are
classified as available-for-sale.&#160; Fair
value of investments is determined based on quoted market prices.&#160; Mesaba classifies investments with an
original maturity of more than 90 days that mature within one year as
short-term and greater than one year as long-term.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March 31, 2007 and
2006, cash, cash equivalents, short-term and long-term investments totaled
$20.7 million and $30.7 million, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At March 31, 2007 and
2006, Mesaba&#146;s amortized cost and fair value of short and long-term investments
classified as securities available for sale totaled $7.8 million and $10.0
million, respectively, of which gross unrealized gains and losses were
insignificant.&#160; Gross realized gains and
losses were insignificant in fiscal 2007 and 2006, as Mesaba generally held the
investments until maturity.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">5.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Leases</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Aircraft
Leases</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba&#146;s airline
fleet consisted of the following aircraft held under operating leases as of
March 31, 2007:</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.88%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Range&nbsp;(miles)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.44%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.88%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Speed&nbsp;(mph)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.9%;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="34%" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Saab 340</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">49</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">34</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">500</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.44%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">300</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.9%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="34%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">CRJ 200</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">50</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,500</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.44%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.88%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">500</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.9%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba leases its Saab
aircraft through subleases with Northwest under operating leases with initial
terms of up to 17 years that expire between 2014 and 2016.&#160; The sublease agreements with Northwest
contain certain requirements of Mesaba regarding the payment of taxes on the
aircraft, acceptable use of the aircraft, the level of insurance to be
maintained, the maintenance procedures to be performed and the condition of the
aircraft upon their return.&#160; The ASA
allows Mesaba to return Saab aircraft to Northwest upon the occurrence of
certain events, including termination of the ASA.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba subleases its CRJ
200 from Northwest under operating leases with initial terms of up to ten years
that expire in 2015.&#160; The lease agreement
contain certain requirements of Mesaba regarding the payment of taxes on the
aircraft, acceptable use of the aircraft, the level of insurance to be
maintained, the maintenance procedures to be performed and the condition of the
aircraft upon their return to Northwest.&#160;
Northwest reimburses Mesaba&#146;s aircraft rental expense in full under the ASA.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba&#146;s aircraft leases
contain customary return condition provisions, but do not contain any
guaranteed lease residual provisions for which there would be a potential
contingency at the termination of the lease period.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">12</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='12',FILE='C:\JMS\105442\07-15927-1\task2197779\15927-1-mm-05.htm',USER='105442',CD='Jun 19 05:07 2007' -->

above aircraft operating leases for Mesaba&#146;s Saab aircraft require future
minimum rental payments as follows, in thousands:</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">277,987</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The information in the
table above is based on Mesaba&#146;s Saab fleet.&#160;
Payments for the CRJ 200 are currently being made on a month to month
basis.&#160; As Mesaba did not enter into a
lease agreement for any CRJ 900 prior to year end, those future minimum rent
payments are not included in the above tables.&#160;
The estimated annual payment per CRJ 900 is $2.1 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba&#146;s rent expense for
aircraft operating leases (net of deferred rent expense amortization) was $50.3
million and $93.0 million in fiscal 2007 and 2006, respectively (including
$50.5 million and $73.9 million paid to Northwest in fiscal 2007 and 2006,
respectively).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Prior to March 31, 2007,
Mesaba also leased or subleased its 35 Avro aircraft from Northwest.&#160; The Avro lease and sublease agreements with
Northwest contained certain requirements of Mesaba regarding the payment of
taxes on the aircraft, acceptable use of the aircraft, the level of insurance
to be maintained, the maintenance procedures to be performed and the condition
of the aircraft upon their return to Northwest. The ASA allowed Mesaba to
return Avros to Northwest upon the occurance of certain events, including
termination of the ASA. As of March 31, 2007 all Avros were removed from the
fleet and not reflected in the table above. &#160;Mesaba&#146;s rent expense for the Avro leases was
$11.5 million and $52.6 million in fiscal 2007 and 2006, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Non-Aircraft
Leases</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba leases
land, offices, hangar facilities, equipment and certain terminal facilities
under operating leases through 2028, which provide for approximate future
minimum rental payments as follows as of March 31, in thousands:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="200" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:149.75pt;">
  <p align="left" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableLeft -->Year&nbsp;Ending&nbsp;March&nbsp;31</p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="80" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:60.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Amount</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba&#146;s rent expense for
non-aircraft operating leases was approximately $9.3 million and $12.6 million
in fiscal 2007 and 2006, respectively.&#160;
The large decrease in future minimum rental payments in fiscal 2008 is
the result of the rejection of and renegotiation of facility leases during
bankruptcy.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">13</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='13',FILE='C:\JMS\105442\07-15927-1\task2197779\15927-1-mm-05.htm',USER='105442',CD='Jun 19 05:07 2007' -->

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">6.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Income Taxes</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba&#146;s provision for income
taxes was comprised of the following elements for the years ended March 31, in
thousands:</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>

  <td width="102" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:76.35pt;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

expense differs from the statutory tax expense as follows for the years ended
March 31, in thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0.375pt 0pt;width:4.5pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">SFAS No. 109 requires
that all available evidence, both positive and negative, be considered to
determine whether, based on the weight of that evidence, a valuation allowance
is needed.&#160; Future realization of the tax
benefits of an existing deductible temporary difference or carryforward
ultimately depends on the existence of sufficient taxable income of the
appropriate character within the carryback or carryforward periods available
under the tax law.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At March 31, 2006, due to
Mesaba&#146;s losses resulting from creditors&#146; bankruptcy claims, reductions in its
fleet and the future income projections of a downsized operation, management
determined that the realization of all deferred tax assets from future
profitable operations was not more likely than not.&#160; Under these circumstances, deferred tax</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">14</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='14',FILE='C:\JMS\105442\07-15927-1\task2197779\15927-1-mm-05.htm',USER='105442',CD='Jun 19 05:07 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">assets may only be
recognized to the extent such benefits may be realized through future reversals
of taxable temporary differences.&#160; Mesaba
has performed an analysis and determined that a valuation allowance is required
against deferred tax assets to the extent they cannot be used to offset future
income arising from the expected reversal of taxable differences.&#160; A valuation allowance in the amount of $51.3
million has been provided as of March 31, 2007 to reduce the gross amount of
these assets to the extent necessary to result in an amount that is more likely
than not of being realized.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deferred income taxes
reflect the net tax effects of temporary differences between the carrying
amounts of assets and liabilities for financial reporting purposes and the
amounts used for income tax purposes.&#160; At
March 31, 2007, Mesaba&#146;s deferred tax assets included $42.6 million of federal
NOLs which expire in 2026 and 2027 and $50.6 million of state NOL carryforwards
which expire over the next four to twenty years.&#160; Mesaba also has federal alternative minimum
tax credits of $0.4 million which expire in 2024 and 2025.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Further, Section 382 of
the Internal Revenue Code provides that certain transfers of Mesaba&#146;s equity,
or issuances of equity in connection with its restructuring, may impair Mesaba&#146;s
ability to utilize its NOL carryforwards in the future.&#160; Under federal income tax law, a corporation
is generally permitted to deduct from taxable income in any year NOLs carried
forward from prior years.&#160; As mentioned
above, Mesaba has NOL carryforwards which expire at various times over the next
twenty years. Mesaba&#146;s ability to deduct NOL carryforwards could be subject to
a significant limitation due to Mesaba&#146;s ownership change (see Note 1).&#160; The effect of Mesaba&#146;s ownership change on
the NOL carryforwards has not yet been analyzed at this time.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the fourth quarter
of fiscal 2007, Mesaba received verification of a final settlement with the IRS
concerning the IRS&#146; examination of the consolidated tax return for the fiscal
2001 through 2004.&#160; Mesaba recorded an
expense of $2.2 million related to the settlement with the IRS.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">7.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Shareholder&#146;s Equity</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">SARs Plan</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal 2004,
Mesaba approved the SARs plan for key employees and directors.&#160; The exercise price of each SAR is equal to
the fair market value of MAIR&#146;s common stock on the date of the award.&#160; Cash is paid based on the difference between
the fair market value at the date of grant and the date the SAR is
exercised.&#160; The SARs vest over four years
and have a ten-year term.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal 2007, the
adoption of SFAS 123R has resulted in an expense of $0.3 million related to the
SARs.&#160; These amounts have been included
in the &#147;Wages and benefits&#148; caption in the accompanying statements of
operations for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Upon adoption on April 1,
2006, in accordance with SFAS 123R, Mesaba also recorded $0.5 million for the
cumulative effect of a change in accounting principle during the fist quarter
of fiscal 2007 as a result of valuing SARs under the fair value method.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A summary of Mesaba&#146;s SAR
activity since March 31, 2006 was as follows:</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.78%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.86%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:14.94%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.48%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="40%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:40.08%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cancelled</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.78%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(125,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0.375pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.86%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9.34</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:14.94%;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Balance at March
  31, 2007</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:.34%;">

  <td width="40%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:40.08%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Options exercisable at

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:2.38%;">

  <td width="17" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="67" style="border:none;"></td>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The aggregate intrinsic
value of SARs outstanding or exercisable at March 31, 2007 was zero.&#160; The aggregate intrinsic value is calculated
as the difference between the exercise price of the underlying SARs and the
market price of the common stock.&#160; The
fair value of SARs vested during fiscal 2007 and 2006 was $0.4 million and $0.3
million, respectively.&#160; All of the Mesaba
SARs were cancelled on April 24, 2007.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">15</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='15',FILE='C:\JMS\105442\07-15927-1\task2197779\15927-1-mm-05.htm',USER='105442',CD='Jun 19 05:07 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Unrecognized Compensation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March 31, 2007,
Mesaba had $0.4 million of total unrecognized compensation cost related to the
non-vested SARs compensation arrangements granted under the SAR plans.&#160; Total unrecognized compensation will be adjusted
for future changes in estimated forfeitures.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">8.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Commitments and
Contingencies</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Workforce</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Approximately 40% of
Mesaba&#146;s workforce consists of members of unions representing pilots,
mechanics, dispatchers and flight attendants.&#160;
Early on in its bankruptcy proceedings, Mesaba reached an agreement to
modify its collective bargaining agreement (&#147;CBA&#148;) with its dispatchers.&#160; Subsequently, Mesaba sought approval from the
Bankruptcy Court to reject the existing CBAs with the remaining three unions
and impose new contract terms on each labor union.&#160; In late October 2006, Mesaba reached
tentative agreements with its pilots, flight attendants and mechanics.&#160; Each union voted to ratify its respective
agreement, and the new pay rates took effect on December 1, 2006.&#160; As part of the agreements, the unions were
allowed claims totaling $22.7 million based on the present value of the wages
and benefits concessions contained within the unions&#146; agreements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Benefit
Plans</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba maintains a 401(k)
benefit plan for eligible employees.&#160;
Mesaba will match 25% to 125% of employee contributions to the plan, up
to 10% of each employee&#146;s eligible earnings, depending on the employee&#146;s length
of service.&#160; Mesaba&#146;s expense related to
the plan totaled $2.7 million and $3.3 million in fiscal 2007 and 2006,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In fiscal 2007, Mesaba
began a separate 401(k) benefit plan for its pilots whereby contributions to
the plan are at the discretion of Mesaba.&#160;
Mesaba&#146;s expense related to the new pilot plan was zero in fiscal 2007.
Beginning in fiscal 2008, the pilot plan mirrors the plan for other eligible
employees.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Regulatory
Matters</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba is party to
ongoing FAA proceedings arising in the ordinary course of business.&#160; In the opinion of management, the resolution
of these matters will not have a material adverse effect on Mesaba&#146;s financial
position, results of operations or cash flows.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Litigation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">From time to time, Mesaba
has been a party to legal and tax proceedings arising in the ordinary course of
business.&#160; See Note 1 for a discussion of
Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy proceedings.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Saab
Leasing Litigation</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2002, Fairbrook
Leasing, Inc., Lambert Leasing, Inc. and Swedish Aircraft Holdings AB (&#147;Saab
Leasing&#148;) filed a declaratory judgment action against Mesaba relating to 20
Saab 340A (&#147;340A&#148;) aircraft leased by Mesaba.&nbsp; In 2003, the District Court
declared that the term sheet relating to the leases for the 340A aircraft was a
binding preliminary agreement requiring Mesaba to negotiate in good faith
toward the execution of long-term agreements for each of the 340A
aircraft.&nbsp; Mesaba appealed this ruling, and while the appeal was pending,
Saab Leasing (relying on the District Court&#146;s declaratory judgment ruling)
filed a separate action in the District Court alleging approximately $35
million in damages for past due and future aircraft lease obligations.&nbsp;
While the damages action was pending, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Eighth
Circuit affirmed the District Court&#146;s declaratory judgment ruling.&#160; Despite the Eighth Circuit&#146;s ruling, Mesaba
believed, based on advice from its legal counsel, that it had defenses in the
damages case that limited Saab Leasing&#146;s ability to recover damages.&nbsp; The
District Court in the damages action agreed, and on July 6, 2006, granted
Mesaba&#146;s motion for partial summary judgment and ruled that Saab Leasing is not
eligible to receive damages for the majority of its claims against Mesaba.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Because the potential
damages for the remaining claim against Mesaba are not significant, Mesaba
never established any accrual with regard to this litigation within its
condensed financial statements. However, Mesaba was unable to reach a
settlement with Saab Leasing within the context of Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy
proceedings; thus, Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy estate consented to lift the automatic
stay and allow Saab Leasing to appeal the District Court&#146;s July 2006 ruling to
the Eighth Circuit Court of Appeals.&#160;
Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy estate will now be required to fund any litigation
expenses and any amounts that may be due to Saab Leasing if the District Court&#146;s
ruling is reversed.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">16</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='16',FILE='C:\JMS\105442\07-15927-1\task2197779\15927-1-mm-05.htm',USER='105442',CD='Jun 19 05:07 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Goldman
Bankruptcy Claim</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Goldman LP is the largest
creditor in Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy proceedings, and it holds approximately $58
million in disputed claims asserted by itself or purchased from other
creditors.&#160; All of Goldman LP&#146;s disputed claims
are for aircraft and equipment leases that were rejected by Mesaba.&nbsp;
Goldman LP has asserted that the stipulated loss provisions of the applicable
leases, under which liquidated damages are calculated, should apply to
determine the total claim amount due to Goldman LP.&nbsp; Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy
estate has filed for summary judgment with the Bankruptcy Court asserting that
the liquidated damages constitute unenforceable penalties.&nbsp; Mesaba&#146;s
bankruptcy trustee instead believes that the claim allowed to Goldman LP should
reflect actual damages suffered, which is the amount related to Goldman LP&#146;s
claim that is recorded in Mesaba&#146;s liabilities subject to compromise.&nbsp;
Mesaba&#146;s bankruptcy estate will be funding the litigation expenses related to
the Goldman LP claim and will be responsible for making a distribution to
Goldman LP following resolution of the claim.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other
Litigation Matters</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Although prior to its
bankruptcy, Mesaba was a defendant in various lawsuits arising in the ordinary
course of business, those lawsuits will be settled and discharged via the
bankruptcy proceedings.&#160; Any liabilities
that remain from pre-petition lawsuits must be satisfied through the bankruptcy
liquidating trust.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Other
Guarantees</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mesaba has letters of
credit to guarantee certain obligations principally for workers&#146; compensation
policies, airport leases and other obligations, which totaled $4.6 million and
$4.1 million as of March 31, 2007 and 2006, respectively.&#160; There were no amounts drawn on these letters
of credit during fiscal 2007 or 2006.&#160; As
collateral for these letters of credit, Mesaba had $4.8 million and $4.5
million in cash held in an investment account as of March 31, 2007 and 2006,
respectively.&#160; This amount is restricted
and has been classified within &#147;Long-term investments&#148; in Mesaba&#146;s balance
sheets.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">9.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Liabilities Subject
to Compromise</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Liabilities subject to
compromise in Mesaba&#146;s condensed balance sheets at March 31, 2007 and 2006
refers to both secured and unsecured obligations that will be accounted for
under a plan of reorganization, including claims incurred prior to the Petition
Date.&#160; They represent the estimated
amount expected to be allowed, plus interest, on known or potential claims to
be resolved through the Chapter 11 bankruptcy process and remain subject to
future adjustments arising from negotiated settlements, actions of the
Bankruptcy Court, rejection of executory contracts and unexpired leases, the
determination as to the value of any collateral securing claims, proofs of
claim or other events.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Although Mesaba has
estimated the value of the claims that will be allowed by the Bankruptcy Court
at $94.4 million, the Bankruptcy Court will make the final determination
regarding what portion of the $245.7 million in total proofs of claim filed
will be deemed allowable claims.&#160; The
determination of how those liabilities will ultimately be treated will not be
known until the claims resolution process is complete.&#160; Mesaba worked with its creditors&#146; committee
and with MAIR to resolve as many proofs of claim as possible prior to the
confirmation of its plan of reorganization.&#160;
The proceeds from the sale of Mesaba&#146;s claim in Northwest&#146;s bankruptcy
have been placed in a liquidating trust and are being held for distribution to
Mesaba&#146;s creditors and MAIR.&#160; A
liquidating trustee has been appointed to work with the creditors&#146; committee
and with MAIR to continue to resolve any outstanding proofs of claim.&#160; As a result, the amounts of liabilities
subject to compromise may change.&#160; See
Note 1 for a discussion of Mesaba&#146;s plan of reorganization</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">17</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

subject to compromise at March 31, 2007 and 2006 were as follows, in thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 18.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-18.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">10.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Reorganization Items</b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Reorganization items
recorded from the Petition Date through March 31, 2007 consisted of
transactions and events that were directly associated with the reorganization
of Mesaba.&#160; The reorganization activity
included aircraft impairment and other rejection charges, legal and
professional fees to support the restructuring process, interest income and the
write-off of maintenance accruals.&#160; The
charge for damage claims results from estimated claims as a result of Mesaba&#146;s
rejection or renegotiation of certain aircraft and other leases and obligations
as part of the bankruptcy process.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net reorganization items
for the year ended March 31, 2007 and 2006 were as follows, in thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">11.&#160; Property and Equipment Held for Sale</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March 31, 2007,
Mesaba reclassified $2.6 million of surplus Avro rotable and repairables from &#147;Flight
equipment&#148; to &#147;Property and equipment held for sale&#148; to properly reflect the
value of the excess Avro parts which Mesaba is in the process of putting on the
market to sell to other Avro operators.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">18</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">
